original: Paṭisambhidāmagga
analyzed: paṭisambhidā magga
translated: The Path of Discrimination

original: 3 Paññāvagga
analyzed: paññāvagga
translated: The Chapter on Wisdom

original: 3.7. Samasīsakathā
analyzed: sama sīsa kathā
translated: The Discussion of the Equal-headed Nails

original: Sabbadhammānaṁ sammāsamucchede nirodhe ca anupaṭṭhānatā paññā samasīsaṭṭhe ñāṇaṁ.
analyzed: sabba dhammānam sammā samucchede nirodhe ca an upaṭṭhāna tā paññā sama sīsa ṭṭhe ñāṇa
translated: The knowledge of the equal-headed nails is the wisdom that does not attend to the cutting off and cessation of all ideas.

original: Sabbadhammānanti pañcakkhandhā, dvādasāyatanāni, aṭṭhārasa dhātuyo, kusalā dhammā,
analyzed: sabba dhammānanti pañca kkhandhāḥ dvādasa āyatanāni aṭṭhārasa dhātuyaḥ kusalāḥ dhammā
translated: “All ideas”: the five constituents (of mind and bodily form), the twelve sense-fields, the eighteen elements, profitable ideas,

original: akusalā dhammā, abyākatā dhammā, kāmāvacarā dhammā, rūpāvacarā dhammā, arūpāvacarā
analyzed: akusalāḥ dhammāḥ abyākatāḥ dhammā kāmāvacarāḥ dhammāḥ rūpāvacarāḥ dhammāḥ arūpāvacarā
translated: unprofitable ideas, indeterminate ideas, ideas of the sense-sphere, ideas of the fine-material sphere, ideas of the immaterial sphere,

original: dhammā, apariyāpannā dhammā.
analyzed: dhammāḥ a pariyāpannāḥ dhammā
translated: ideas not directly attached to the fine-material sphere or immaterial sphere.

original: Sammā samucchedeti nekkhammena kāmacchandaṁ sammā samucchindati, abyāpādena byāpādaṁ🔽sammā samucchindati, ālokasaññāya thinamiddhaṁ sammā samucchindati, avikkhepena uddhaccaṁ
analyzed: sammā nekkhammena kāmacchandam sammā samucchindati a byāpādena byāpāda  sammā samucchindati āloka saññāya thinam iddham sammā samucchindati avikkhepena uddhat ca
translated: “Cutting off”: he cuts off sense-desire by renunciation, he cuts off ill will by non-ill will,🔽he cuts off stiffness and torpor by perception of light, he cuts off agitation and worry by non-agitation,

original: sammā samucchindati, dhammavavatthānena vicikicchaṁ sammā samucchindati, ñāṇena avijjaṁ
analyzed: sammā samucchindati dhamma vavatthānena vicikiccham sammā samucchindati ñāṇena avijja
translated: he cuts off uncertainty by defining of ideas, he cuts off ignorance by knowledge,

original: sammā samucchindati, pāmojjena aratiṁ sammā samucchindati, paṭhamena jhānena nīvaraṇe
analyzed: sammā samucchindati pāmojjena aratim sammā samucchindati paṭhamena jhānena nīvaraṇe
translated: he cuts off discontent by gladness, he cuts off the hindrances by the first jhana …

original: sammā samucchindati …pe…
analyzed: sammā samucchindati pe
translated: … he cuts them off completely. …

original: arahattamaggena sabbakilese sammā samucchindati.🔽Nirodheti nekkhammena kāmacchandaṁ nirodheti, abyāpādena byāpādaṁ nirodheti, ālokasaññāya
analyzed: arahatta maggena sabba kilese sammā samucchindati  nirodheti nekkhammena kāmacchandam nirodheti abyāpādena byāpādam nirodheti āloka saññāya
translated: with the path of arahatship he completely eradicates all the defilements.🔽He stops sensual desire by means of renunciation, he stops ill will by means of non-ill will, he stops stiffness and torpor by means of the perception of light,

original: thinamiddhaṁ nirodheti, avikkhepena uddhaccaṁ nirodheti, dhammavavatthānena vicikicchaṁ🔽nirodheti, ñāṇena avijjaṁ nirodheti, pāmojjena aratiṁ nirodheti, paṭhamena jhānena
analyzed: thinamiddham nirodheti avikkhepena uddhaccam nirodheti dhamma vavatthānena vicikiccha  nirodha iti ñāṇena avijjam nirodha iti pāmojjena aratim nirodha iti paṭhamena jhānena
translated: he stops agitation by means of non-distraction, he stops uncertainty by means of defining of ideas,

original: nīvaraṇe nirodheti …pe…
analyzed: nīvaraṇe nirodha iti pe
translated: he stops ignorance by means of knowledge, he stops discontent by means of gladness, he stops the hindrances by means of the first jhana …

original: arahattamaggena sabbakilese nirodheti.🔽Anupaṭṭhānatāti nekkhammaṁ paṭiladdhassa kāmacchando na upaṭṭhāti, abyāpādaṁ paṭiladdhassa🔽byāpādo na upaṭṭhāti, ālokasaññaṁ paṭiladdhassa thinamiddhaṁ na upaṭṭhāti, avikkhepaṁ
analyzed: arahatta maggena sabba kilese nirodheti  an upaṭṭhāna tā ati nekkhammam paṭiladdhassa kāmacchandaḥ na upaṭṭhāti a byāpādam paṭiladdhassa  byāpādaḥ na upaṭṭhāti āloka saññam paṭiladdhassa thinamiddham na upaṭṭhāti avikkhepa
translated: he stops all the defilements by means of the path of arahatship.🔽Non-appearance: when renunciation is obtained sensual desire does not appear,🔽when non-ill will is obtained ill will does not appear, when the perception of light is obtained stiffness and torpor do not appear, when non-distraction is obtained agitation does not appear, when the defining of ideas is obtained uncertainty does not appear,

original: paṭiladdhassa uddhaccaṁ na upaṭṭhāti, dhammavavatthānaṁ paṭiladdhassa vicikicchā
analyzed: paṭiladdhassa uddhaccam na upaṭṭhāti dhamma vavatthānam paṭiladdhassa vicikicchā
translated: when knowledge is obtained ignorance does not appear, when gladness is obtained discontent does not appear,

original: na upaṭṭhāti, ñāṇaṁ paṭiladdhassa avijjā na upaṭṭhāti, pāmojjaṁ paṭiladdhassa arati
analyzed: na upaṭṭhāti ñāṇam paṭiladdhassa avijjā na upaṭṭhāti pāmojjam paṭiladdhassa arati
translated: When he has attained knowledge, ignorance does not occur. When he has attained gladness, discontent does not occur.

original: na upaṭṭhāti, paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ paṭiladdhassa nīvaraṇā na upaṭṭhanti …pe…
analyzed: na upaṭṭhāti paṭhamam jhānam paṭiladdhassa nīvaraṇāḥ na upaṭṭhanti pe
translated: When he has attained the first jhāna, the hindrances do not occur. …

original: arahattamaggaṁ paṭiladdhassa sabbakilesā na upaṭṭhanti.
analyzed: arahatta maggam paṭiladdhassa sabba kilesāḥ na upaṭṭhanti
translated: When he has attained the path of arahatship, all defilements do not occur.

original: Samanti kāmacchandassa pahīnattā nekkhammaṁ samaṁ, byāpādassa pahīnattā abyāpādo🔽samaṁ, thinamiddhassa pahīnattā ālokasaññā samaṁ, uddhaccassa pahīnattā avikkhepo
analyzed: kāmacchandassa pahīna ttā nekkhammam byāpādassa pahīna ttā a byāpādaḥ  thinamiddhassa pahīna ttā āloka saññā sama uddhaccassa pahīna ttā avikkhepo
translated: “Even” : because sense desire is abandoned, renunciation is even; because ill will is abandoned, non-ill will is even;🔽because stiffness and torpor are abandoned, perception of light is even; because agitation is abandoned, non-distraction is even;

original: samaṁ, vicikicchāya pahīnattā dhammavavatthānaṁ samaṁ, avijjāya pahīnattā ñāṇaṁ samaṁ,
analyzed: vicikicchāya pahīna ttā dhamma vavatthānam sama avijjāya pahīna ttā ñāṇam sama
translated: because uncertainty is abandoned, definition of dhammas is even; because ignorance is abandoned, knowledge is even;

original: aratiyā pahīnattā pāmojjaṁ samaṁ, nīvaraṇānaṁ pahīnattā paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ samaṁ …pe…
analyzed: aratiyā pahīnattā pāmojjam nīvaraṇānam pahīnattā paṭhamam jhānam samam
translated: because discontent is abandoned, gladness is even; because the hindrances are abandoned, the first jhāna is even; …

original: sabbakilesānaṁ pahīnattā arahattamaggo samaṁ.
analyzed: sabba kilesānam pahīna ttā arahatta maggo
translated: because all defilements are abandoned, the path of arahatship is even.

original: Sīsanti terasa sīsāni—
analyzed: sīsanti terasa sīsāni
translated: “Head” : there are thirteen heads:

original: palibodhasīsañca taṇhā, vinibandhanasīsañca māno, parāmāsasīsañca diṭṭhi, vikkhepasīsañca
analyzed: palibodha sīsañca taṇhā vinibandhana sīsañca māno parāmāsa sīsañca diṭṭhi vikkhepa sīsañca
translated: Craving is the head of the hindrances, conceit is the head of the bonds, views are the head of misapprehensions,

original: uddhaccaṁ, saṅkilesasīsañca avijjā, adhimokkhasīsañca saddhā, paggahasīsañca vīriyaṁ,
analyzed: uddhat ca saṅkilesa sīsañca avijjā adhimokkha sīsañca saddhā paggaha sīsañca vīriya
translated: agitation is the head of distraction, ignorance is the head of defilement, faith is the head of resolution, energy is the head of exertion,

original: upaṭṭhānasīsañca sati, avikkhepasīsañca samādhi, dassanasīsañca paññā, pavattasīsañca
analyzed: upaṭṭhāna sīsañca sati avikkhepa sīsañca samādhi dassana sīsañca paññā pavatta sīsañca
translated: mindfulness is the head of establishment, concentration is the head of non-distraction, wisdom is the head of seeing,

original: jīvitindriyaṁ, gocarasīsañca vimokkho, saṅkhārasīsañca nirodhoti.
analyzed: jīvitindriya gocara sīsañca vimokkho saṅkhāra sīsañca nirodho ti
translated: the life faculty is the head of occurrence, the liberations are the head of the domain, cessation is the head of formations.

original: Samasīsakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sama sīsa kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Discussion of the Head is finished.
